result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas K. Torgerson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*After 1 year, DOC agent has authority to end probation early if defendant has been successful while on probation, has followed all the rules, and has been responsible with guns.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No firearms in his home (given 10 days to store them elsewhere).
May go to and participate in trap league at a sanctioned range for purposes of trap shooting league or practice, but may not transport gun there.  
May go hunting with another person, but may not transport gun to hunting land. The other person will have to be the one who is transporting the firearm for him and with him.  After the hunt, the weapon goes home with somebody else.

Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Forfeit gun used in the commission of this crime.
Undergo AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations.

No use, consumption, or possession of alcohol.  
No entry into bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed to be used at agent discretion.
Jail may be served by 40 hours of community service before being imposed by agent (defendant indicates he will do community service hours)
10-20-16: Denied Eau Claire County Community Service Program. Community Service order to be monitored by St. Croix County Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas K. Torgerson Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10-20-16: Denied Eau Claire County Community Service Program. Community Service order to be monitored by St. Croix County Probation Agent.

The defendant was denied for participation in the Eau Claire County Community Service program because the defendant moved outside of Eau Claire County and Probation was transferred. The Probation Agent in St. Croix County will be responsible for monitoring the court order of community service.
